newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy parliament commission backs Autostrade sale.
newsitem.headline: Italy parliament commission backs Autostrade sale.

text.p: The environment commission of Italy's lower house of parliament voted in favour on Wednesday of government plans to privatise Italy's main motorway operator, Autostrade Spa, parliamentary officials said.
The centre-left government plans to sell Autostrade, now owned by state holding IRI, by June.

The Chamber of Deputies commission, in its non-binding advice, said a proposed hard core of shareholders should control 20 to 25 percent of the stock and be barred from disposing of their holding for three years.
The commission had been required to express an opinion on the planned sale. The competent commission of the Senate was due to discuss the issue on Wednesday afternoon.
